Flock of Birds® configuration steps:

Hardware Settings

Serial Port

Set the serial port to which the Flock of Birds is connected.

Baud

Set the baud for the serial port.

Hemisphere

Set the hemisphere of the transmitter within which the user(s) will be operating.

Master Address

Set the Fast Bird Bus (FBB) address of the master bird. This is determined by the DIP switch settings on the birds. With EPROM version 3.67 or newer, this value will be detected automatically by the device driver. Otherwise, it must be set correctly here.

Addressing Mode

Set the addressing mode. This will depend on the type of Flock hardware being used. With EPROM verrsion 3.67 or newer, this value will be detected automatically by the device driver. Otherwise, it must be set correctly here.

Filter

Set the filter. This value is currently ignored by the device driver.

Device Host

CLUSTER ONLY: Set the cluster node where the Flock of Birds® is physically attached. This determines which node will run the device driver.

Transmitter Settings

Under the Transmitter, you will find the settings for the placement of the Flock of Birds® transmitter (a small white cube or a big, heavy black box). The orientation and position of the transmitter are configured relative to the VR Juggler coordinate frame. Remember that the transmitter coordinate frame has negative X coming out of the face with the power cord and positive Y to the left of the front face. Refer to Page 142 of the Flock of Birds® Installation and Operation Guide (910141 Rev A1, published January 31, 2002).

Configure the position and orientation of the Flock of Birds® transmitter (the large black box) relative to the VR Juggler coordinate frame. This process configures what is known as a "position transform filter." The panels titled "Orientation" and "Position" present an easy way to perform this task.

Orientatino

First, choose the coordinate frame rotation from the Transmitter Coordinate Frame list. To enter the X, Y, and Z rotation values directly, click the Manual Entry button and fill in the values to the right of the list.

Position

Next, set the position of the transmitter relative to the chosen VR Juggler origin. The units can be entered as meters, centimeters, feet, or inches. Make sure to pick the units before entering the location value.

Tracker Units

Set the physical units of the data returned by the sensors. Currently, the Flock of Birds tracking system only returns inches, but the device driver always reinterprets this as Feet. Therefore, Feet must be chosen.

Sensor Settings
